speaker: Dungeon Master & NPCs
lines: Griffin McElroy

speaker: Aubrey Little/Lady Flame
lines: Travis McElroy

speaker: Edmund ‘Ned’ Chicane
lines: Clint McElroy

speaker: Duck Newton
lines: Justin McElroy

speaker: Griffin
lines: Previously, on The Adventure Zone…

speaker: Griffin
lines: Duck you see, a vision. You see a stone archway.

speaker: Pidgeon
lines: I ran into somethin’, out in the woods. My buddy Pete, we ran out into somethin’ out in the woods and he’s still out there.

speaker: Duck
lines: ‘Bout the biggest animal we get in these parts is the good ol’, Black Bear.

speaker: Pidgeon
lines: You got somethin’ waaay bigger in these woods.

speaker: Griffin
lines: You touch your finger to the back of the card, it actually kind of, explodes.

speaker: Mama
lines: C’mon now, I know real magic when I see it, fess up! You thought you’d just go blowin’ up ski lodges all willy-nilly like that?

speaker: Aubrey
lines: I’d be happy to talk to you more, in the truck, away from here, please.

speaker: Mama
lines: Alright Aubrey, it’s nice to meet you. I’m Mama.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Uh, you tear it open, and it’s an eviction notice!

speaker: Kirby
lines: Desperate times call for desperate measures, get out in the woods and take some blurry fuckin’ pictures, I don’t know! Whatever people usually do to make Bigfoot stuff happen!

speaker: Griffin
lines: Ned, you start planning your next grift. You are going to bring Bigfoot to Kepler!

speaker: [Theme music (The Adventure Zone
lines: Amnesty Theme by Griffin McElroy) plays]

speaker: Griffin
lines: So, we have more scenes this week, and I promise you guys are gonna meet up and the mystery’s gonna start to… unravel itself? But before we get to that, just a couple more sorta setup scenes and our first one is with Duck, again. Hi, Duck! I’m now talking to a fictional character, so I’m not really sure how that works.

speaker: Justin
lines: It’s actually pretty weird, I’ll just address you as Justin. Hello, Griffin.

speaker: Griffin
lines: So, Duck, you’ve been following the trail of this… thing, whatever it is, for an hour and a half now. You’ve mostly been pursuing the sort of drops of black ooze that, as they reach deeper into the forest, they glint off of your flashlight’s light, making it surprisingly easy to follow. And it’s at this point in the forest where you’ve been walking about an hour and a half, you’re well away from the trails and the lights of the town, that you actually see another light, shining in your direction from deeper within. And it’s low to the ground, it’s beaming in your direction, cutting through the trees, and this light is not moving. What do you do?

speaker: Justin
lines: I guess I approach it.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay! You… approach the light, and as you do so, your eyes kind of adjust to it, and this scene reveals itself to you. The light you spotted earlier is actually a flashlight that is laying on the forest floor, it’s like half-submerged in a little muddy patch. And it was left on and dropped. But what’s more notable in this area is the forest floor itself. There’s large patches of the ground where the grass is just blackened in this strange pattern, almost like it was burnt. There’s big splotches here and there of burnt, you think, grass, and each of those splotches has a few smaller lengths of burnt grass extending off of them. And, there’s another sort of strange thing here, too, and that’s there’s just, like… no sound. The sort of ambient sound of crickets and frogs and the occasional hoot from an owl, there’s none of that there. The night has become just completely still in this place. Which is why it freaks you out all the more when you hear a voice… that you haven’t heard in many, many years, say

speaker: Presence
lines: Duck Newton! The moment of your destiny has arrived!

speaker: Griffin
lines: And there, standing before you, is... a presence, and it’s a presence you first saw… some number of years ago, and that’s something we’re gonna have to figure out together. She, like you saw so many years ago, she has no real features that you can make out, she’s just sort of this outline of a person made of this faint blue light? She’s roughly about six feet tall, with a long neck ending in a large, seemingly bald head, and that’s all that you’re really able to make out, looking at her. And I guess it’s kind of time that we talk about Duck’s… visions that he gets as part of The Chosen, which you and I kinda briefly talked about, and you gave the okay on sort of being represented by this person that would visit Duck from time to time. Let’s take this moment actually to sort of talk about Duck’s destiny… which sounds a lot like Duck Dynasty.

speaker: Travis
lines: Yeah! Eugh!

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yikes! When did Duck sort of first become aware of his role as The Chosen? When was, like, the last time you saw this vision, ‘cause it’s been a while.

speaker: Justin
lines: On his… 18th birthday.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay. And when—

speaker: Justin
lines: And it happened for a while after that, I mean, a few weeks. And then maybe occasionally after, y’know, once or twice a month, but, I think- I feel like they became… the way I’m seeing is, is they were very— it was, like, very clear at the beginning, and then the longer it sort of went on, more sort of ephemeral and maybe almost dreamlike—

speaker: Clint
lines: Were they dreams? Were they comin’ to him in dreams, or actively just…

speaker: Justin
lines: No, no, I think maybe that is what he has convinced himself? But I think it’s closer to what Griffin describes, it was a presence that visited him and said these things and then… y’know, I think that eventually over time, you can convince yourself of a lot of stuff. He convinced himself that it was just that, just dreams.

speaker: Griffin
lines: I love that idea, of it being dreamlike, and that this happened so long ago— ‘cause we should also talk about- you talked about Duck being, like, not, like, a kid? Like, older than 20s?

speaker: Justin
lines: Yeah, he’s mid-40s now.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Mid-forties, and so it’s probably been long enough now that you’ve kind of convinced yourself it was just a dream, or something. But that probably makes it even all the more alarming that here she is again, and she says

speaker: Presence
lines: There is no more time to delay, Duck Newton. Events have been put into motion that require your immediate action.

speaker: Duck
lines: All right.

speaker: Justin
lines: And I turn heel and start walking away.

speaker: Presence
lines: Duck Newton, wait! I must know if you’ve been training your body to achieve and maintain peak physical capabilities, Duck Newton!

speaker: Duck
lines: Well, I...you know what I did try that, uh...crossfit. Darren opened up one of them crossfit places, they do BAIT during the day and then during the evenings they got CrossFit.

speaker: Clint
lines: [laughs] BAIT and CrossFit!

speaker: Duck
lines: And I tried it, I’ll be honest that was a little... (trails off)

speaker: Presence
lines: And did you master this martial art of crossed fit, Duck Newton?

speaker: Duck
lines: Well, the first class was free, but honestly the way my schedule is sometimes, I didn’t think I’d be able to dedicate as much time as it required to really make the membership pay off. You know how it goes.

speaker: Griffin
lines: This vision sort of disappears and reappears like, right next to you, and now she’s like looking you over. And she says

speaker: Presence
lines: Where is your Chosen weapon, Duck Newton? Where is the instrument of your destiny?

speaker: Duck
lines: I, uh, [clicks tongue] you know what, honestly, it kinda creeped me out, so I uh, I had a friend hold on to it. It was kind of just, I’ll be honest, it kinda wigged me out, you know. I mean, I don’t know, I’m not even gonna say I have a design aesthetic, but uh, weird bendy sword doesn’t exactly fit whatever it is that I’m trying to achieve. You know how it goes.

speaker: Griffin
lines: She says

speaker: Presence
lines: Duck Newton, I know well of your hesitance. But you must know that I have waited long enough. It is now the time—

speaker: Griffin
lines: And you hear a sound in the woods, just like several dozen feet away. You hear the snapping of a big branch. And then you hear this deep, monstrous sigh. And then another, and another, like, steady breathing now and it’s moving closer to you. And this vision says

speaker: Presence
lines: Duck Newton, are you in dange—?

speaker: Griffin
lines: And then the vision disappears. What do you do?

speaker: Justin
lines: I feel like there’s a lot of this stuff that is… I feel like whatever quote unquote abilities Duck had have become rather rusty. But I still feel like his, maybe, stuff is better than it would be for a regular person. So I feel like he has an ability to sort of like, sense danger.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah.

speaker: Justin
lines: Or sense enemies coming that’d go beyond what regular people could do. So I think he kind of is able to train in on whatever is coming after him and try to read the situation.

speaker: Griffin
lines: You think this is a Read a Bad Situation then?

speaker: Justin
lines: I do. It seems like a bad situation to me.

speaker: Griffin
lines: [amused] Yeah, I would definitely say it’s a bad situation.

speaker: Justin
lines: And one in dire need of being read.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah, go ahead and do it.

speaker: Justin
lines: Five, three, plus Sharp. It’s a nine.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay, mixed result. Hold one. You get to ask me one question What’s the best way in? What’s the best way out? Are there any dangers you haven’t noticed? What’s the biggest threat? What’s most vulnerable to me? And what’s the best way to protect the victims?

speaker: Justin
lines: I would probably ask what’s the biggest threat?

speaker: Griffin
lines: It is… I will give you two things with that. The first thing you notice as you kind of turn your light towards the sound, is you get a clear picture of this pattern of burnt grass on the ground, which you couldn’t really see until you’re, at your current position, shining your light over the whole of it. And it’s not just like random splotches of burnt grass, it almost looks like the shadows of animals. You can see kinda clearly like, they’re all kinda jumbled up but you can kinda see like a deer? Like a shape of a deer on the ground. A couple of them actually. And you see the shape of either a dog or a wolf kinda like sticking out of the mass of the pile. And the other thing you notice, that is sort of more relevant to you, is that you faintly see the shape that Pigeon described to you. You see a hulking, eight-foot shape that is moving towards you, and as you shine the light in its direction, you catch eyes with the light. I think actually you get two eyes, sort of where you expect eyes on this thing to be, and very very faintly you also catch a couple of other eyes in places that maybe eyes shouldn’t be. And as you flash it, you hear this shape roar, and now it’s moving towards you very quickly.

speaker: Justin
lines: Alright, I raise the hunting rifle in my hands, and I chuck it at its head as hard as I can before I sprint away.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Um, yeah, so there is a Fight thing. This is absolutely not that. Not kicking some ass.

speaker: Justin
lines: No, this is Act Under Pressure, I feel like.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah, go ahead and roll plus Cool.

speaker: Justin
lines: Five.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Wuh-oh.

speaker: Travis
lines: How cool is Duck?

speaker: Griffin
lines: Mark experience.

speaker: Justin
lines: You guys try fucking acting under pressure when a multi-eyed demon is coming at you. I don’t blame him.

speaker: Griffin
lines: So I get to make a hard move, ‘cause you fucked up. Mark experience, which is good. Every time you fail, you mark experience.

speaker: Justin
lines: Hey, experience.

speaker: Travis
lines: That’s a hearty balm.

speaker: Justin
lines: [to Clint] Papa, can you get that orange pencil out of that highlighter mug for me, thank you.

speaker: Clint
lines: [in a Yoda impression] Learn from failure, we do.

speaker: Justin
lines: One big experience.

speaker: Justin
lines: Goes down smooth, boys, let me tell ya.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Alright, here’s what I’m gonna do to you. You throw the hunting rifle, so that’s gone now, you just lose that. And you try to turn tail and run. And you are just not fast enough. This thing that is marching out of the woods collides with you with, I think, just a big ol’ paw, just swipes you and knocks you to the ground. And you roll about 10 feet away. As you roll a couple of tyour things also come off. This is a price you are paying for fucking up this bad. First off, take two harm, as you are swatted by this big big monster.

speaker: Justin
lines: Okay, so no harm. I’m Invincible.

speaker: Griffin
lines: What?

speaker: Justin
lines: I’m Invincible. I always count as having two armor.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Ohhhh. That’s a Chosen thing?

speaker: Justin
lines: Yeah, it’s my big Chosen ability.

speaker: Griffin
lines: I think, so like, in fiction—

speaker: Travis
lines: Sick!

speaker: Griffin
lines: What is that? Do you just have like a magic sort of warding presence? Is this just representative of Duck being like—

speaker: Justin
lines: I’m just tough. I don’t get hurt.

speaker: Travis
lines: Like Buffy. You know Buffy can take a lot of—

speaker: Justin
lines: It’s nothing like Buffy, this is a new IP [laughter] and I’m not gonna write any fucking checks. He just is—

speaker: Griffin
lines: Alright, you—

speaker: Justin
lines: Why does it have to be Buffy? Lots of people are difficult to damage.

speaker: Travis
lines: Yeah.

speaker: Clint
lines: He could just be buff.

speaker: Justin
lines: No, he’s no… there’s no buff sounds. There’s not even a B. It’s just Duck Newton, guy who’s hard to kill.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Alright, yeah, you’re hard to kill. You get swatted away and you don’t take any damage. But there is still a cost, and that is as you roll, you lose your flashlight and your radio.

speaker: Justin
lines: Man, I already lost a gun, that seems excessive. But alright.

speaker: Griffin
lines: It’s a hard move, I can base… you are at my whims at that point, and—

speaker: Justin
lines: Alright. I’m a fan… who am I? [mocking/quoting Griffin] I’m a fan of your character.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah, alright.

speaker: Griffin
lines: But this big monster is kind of a little unsteady as it charges into you and does this attack. It, like, keeps going for a little bit. And your, I’ll say this, your flashlight as it lands, kind of close to the other flashlight that was already on the ground, it is shining into this big, sort of, bramble patch. And inside you see a scared face of a young man wearing some coke-bottle glasses, and a blue sweater, and he’s hiding out in this bramble patch as the monster sort of charges. And the monsters has its back to you for just a brief moment. What do you do?

speaker: Justin
lines: [laughs] I have nothing, right?

speaker: Griffin
lines: You are essentially now unequipped.

speaker: Justin
lines: [whispers] God.

speaker: Griffin
lines: What I love about this game is that there are, it gives me so many more options of putting you guys in legitimate danger. And this is definitely one of those situations.

speaker: Justin
lines: I’m gonna [laughs] I’m trying to think what he would do in this situation, and the answer is he would not kick some ass, but kick its ass. Kick its literal ass. Kick its ass.

speaker: Griffin
lines: With—

speaker: Justin
lines: I’m gonna kick- I’m gonna kick it in the ass.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Uh, okay, you kick it in its ass.

speaker: Justin
lines: Normally this is not what Duck would be doing, by the way, but there, this is somebody who is visiting the park, and they are in danger, and he’s not gonna just, like, leave ‘em. So he’s gonna kick this thing in the ass.

speaker: Griffin
lines: You kick it in its ass, and it very, I mean, you just do it. I don’t think this is a Kick Some Ass roll, because it sort of has its back to you, and it like, doesn’t even register it, really, as hurting. But it turns around quickly and now is facing you, and now you have its attention with this sort of scared guest at the park hiding nearby. What do you do?

speaker: Justin
lines: Are any of the items that I have misplaced, are any of them like within arms reach theoretic— like where I could get to them before this thing could get to me, theoretically.

speaker: Griffin
lines: I think if you were about to, like, turn tail and run this thing away from this victim, I think you could take a beat to pick up one of them. Either the rifle or the radio or the flashlight. But I would need you to roll Cool. I would need you to roll to Act Under Pressure.

speaker: Justin
lines: [makes exasperated sound] All right.

speaker: Griffin
lines: You don’t have to. You don’t have to.

speaker: Justin
lines: No, I’m just- no, I’m thinking. I’m just trying to think what would be—

speaker: Griffin
lines: Let me also give you this. The monster doesn’t seem to see this other person as they are hidden right now. Right now. That could change, but this person’s hiding.

speaker: Justin
lines: Okay, I’ll grab the radio.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay, I need you to Act Under Pressure.

speaker: Justin
lines: Okay, there we go. Finally a decent one. I got an eight.

speaker: Griffin
lines: I’m going to offer you a hard choice.

speaker: Justin
lines: Okay.

speaker: Griffin
lines: On a mixed- which is something I can do on a mixed success. You can get it, this thing’s gonna hit you again.

speaker: Justin
lines: Uh, yeah, I’ll do that. Sure.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay.

speaker: Travis
lines: He’s tough!

speaker: Griffin
lines: You sort of roll out of the way of one of this things swipes, and as you roll you grab the radio and then you feel something at your back as the monster hits you with another swipe, this time for two damage. And this time you go flying about 20 feet, so you are not damaged, but you are now in the woods as this thing knocks you away. And you scramble to your feet, and now this thing is starting to pursue you away from this scene. What do you do?

speaker: Justin
lines: I turn up the volume on the receiver as loud as it’ll go.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay.

speaker: Justin
lines: As I’m running away I start yelling.

speaker: Duck
lines: Come in, we got an emergent situation, I have a… God, alright, unknown assailant and—

speaker: Griffin
lines: Are you saying this as you’re sprinting away from this—

speaker: Justin
lines: Yes.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay.

speaker: Duck
lines: I’m just north of the Cranberry River, and uh, I need immediate- I guess, air support. I know it’s gonna be too long for y’all to get out here but I’m sorta making an immediate egress away to the south. South, yeah, south. I’m headed towards the river. So just follow the river and you’ll see me. Please confirm very loudly that you heard.

speaker: Griffin
lines: [laughs] You are getting some static on the radio.

speaker: Justin
lines: Alright, I adjust the squelch knob so I can try to limit that and get the signal clear.

speaker: Griffin
lines: You’re doing a lot of this in… I’m trying to figure out a way to make this fair, cuz you’re doing a lot of this in the dark while running away from a big bear monster.

speaker: Justin
lines: Yeah.

speaker: Griffin
lines: So I think this is just another Act Under Pressure as you are trying to like tune on this thing as you are running through the woods.

speaker: Justin
lines: Uh, seven.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Seven, mixed success. Okay, you hear a voice say.

speaker: Ranger
lines: [extremely muffled] I can’t hear you. Duck? Duck, come in.

speaker: Duck
lines: Yeah, I’m here!

speaker: Griffin
lines: And now that static is getting kind of louder now, and it’s not like this is another national quiet zone thing where you do have trouble sometimes picking up signals. This ain’t that. Like, something weird is almost jamming the signal and you hear someone saying

speaker: Ranger
lines: [muffled] Alright, we’re gonna send out someone to try and find you, Duck. Where… Duck? I can’t hear you, Duck.

speaker: Griffin
lines: And the price to pay for your mixed success is after getting confirmation on this, you trip over a branch, and now the radio’s just gone. You have no idea where it went. And this thing is still pursuing you. And I think you’re just running now in the dark for a while. And running away from this monster in the dark and there’s— you can hear it close behind you and some branches are whipping up against your invincible face as you are running and running and eventually the sound of that monster gets quieter and quieter and now it’s just gone. And you are sort of safe, you feel safe, and you don’t have a flashlight anymore, but you’re in a clearing. And the moonlight overhead is brilliant and shining straight down like a spotlight on the center of this clearing, where you see that big stone gate.

speaker: Griffin
lines: And we’re gonna move on to Aubrey.

speaker: Travis
lines: Hell yeah!

speaker: Griffin
lines: Aubrey, Mama is driving you down a scenic stretch of highway, on the road out of Snowshoe, and dusk is falling and the leaves in the woods sort of lining the road that you’re on have just begun to fall. It’s the end of summer and they’ve sort of begun their natural patterns. And you are relieved to hear that no police sirens are following you down this road. [Travis Sweet.] And Mama notices you nervously looking behind you and she says

speaker: Mama
lines: Now, you don’t worry too much about the fuzz, okay? I’ve got some pull with the owners of that hotel, that gaudy shithole.

speaker: Aubrey
lines: Oh, okay, great.

speaker: Mama
lines: They ain’t gonna bother you none.

speaker: Aubrey
lines: Well, that leads me to my next question then, I guess. So, are you gonna kill me or what?

speaker: Mama
lines: No-

speaker: Aubrey
lines: Is this like, “You’re driving me somewhere and you’re gonna murder me” kinda thing? What… who the fuck are you, I guess, is now my immediate concern.

speaker: Griffin
lines: She says

speaker: Mama
lines: I’m not planning on murderin’ you, that’s sorta not my MO.

speaker: Aubrey
lines: That would be exactly what someone who was planning to murder me would say.

speaker: Griffin
lines: She kinda smiles as you say that, and she actually reaches one of her huge hands into her duster’s breast pocket. And I think you get nervous just because of the context of the situation. But what she pulls out is actually a small ziploc bag that she sort of rips open with her teeth.

speaker: Travis
lines: Weed!

speaker: Griffin
lines: And she reaches inside and uncurls her fist towards you to reveal a baby carrot. And she says

speaker: Mama
lines: Doc says I gotta eat these for my ticker, I figured your little buddy might be hungry.

speaker: Aubrey
lines: Um, I’m sorry? My little buddy?

speaker: Mama
lines: Your magic rabbit. Dr. Bonkers.

speaker: Aubrey
lines: Thank you. Thank you for using his name and title. He worked hard to get that PhD.

speaker: Griffin
lines: And I think Dr. Bonkers like, I don’t know where he is, where you’ve got him, but he kinda springs forward and is kinda resting on your arm, and takes this baby carrot and starts nibbling on it. And she says

speaker: Mama
lines: This is gonna be kind of a strange question maybe, but, you really are human, aren’t you?

speaker: Aubrey
lines: [hesitantly] Yes?

speaker: Griffin
lines: She says

speaker: Mama
lines: I did warn you it was gonna be a strange question.

speaker: Aubrey
lines: Fair. Yeah. Alright, yeah. Human on my mother and father’s side. Is that an… is that an option?

speaker: Griffin
lines: She laughs and she says

speaker: Mama
lines: Yeah, and you’re gonna learn a lot of stuff tonight I think, and one of ‘em is that it is definitely, definitely an option. What I don’t understand is how you’re able to use magic if you don’t know the truth of the matter.

speaker: Aubrey
lines: Oh, um, well, it’s a lot of flash paper and these gloves have strikers in ‘em.

speaker: Mama
lines: Yeah, that’s all great, but- we can’t keep doin’ this, it’s gonna make sense here in a little bit. And you’ve really never been to Kepler before?

speaker: Aubrey
lines: Not that I know of.

speaker: Griffin
lines: She says

speaker: Mama
lines: Well, that’s a shame. ‘Cause… it’s the best town on Earth.

speaker: Griffin
lines: And as she says that your truck passes through one last stretch of woods, and then the trees disappear, and there’s Kepler. And you’re on the riverside of town now, named for the lower part of the town’s proximity to the Greenbrier River that cuts across its southern border. And the highway you’re on turns into the town’s main road and suddenly you’re passing through this quaint little town’s center. You pass a building called The Cryptonomica, you pass a local grocer, an arcade, a winter sports supply store, a Pizza Hut, a much smaller neighboring independent pizza restaurant. A library, city hall and a bunch of other buildings that you can’t really identify. And then you—

speaker: Travis
lines: Is it fair to assume that the smaller restaurant is a Giovanni’s? Or—

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah, we can say it’s a Gino’s, or a Giovanni’s. And then you’re driving through a few residential— by the way, that’s some hyper-local Huntington, West Virginia callbacks but… [Clint laughs] then you’re driving through a few residential blocks before the road turns back into the highway at the town’s edge. But Mama takes a hairpin left turn and now you’re driving up this winding road that climbs the face of the mountain sort of to the town’s north. You drive under an overpass and you see the town’s funicular train with a couple of passengers riding from riverside up to topside, which the road that you’re on turns into as you reach sort of the end of the winding road’s end, and now you’re passing by some other buildings. There’s the Kepler ski trails landing, a few ritzy-looking chalets on the cliff’s edge and some alpine inspired resorts. And then Mama reaches the end of the road, and she turns one last time onto a small, dirt path, leading into a forest of pine trees. And you drive through this secluded stretch for a half-minute or so, and then—

speaker: Aubrey
lines: Okay, so just real quick I wanna circle back on the “Not going to murder me” thing, right? We could have stopped at Giovanni’s back there. That would have been fine.

speaker: Griffin
lines: She says

speaker: Mama
lines: Oh, are you hungry? You want some carrots?

speaker: Aubrey
lines: No.

speaker: Mama
lines: I can getcha a hot meal here in a little bit, but… oh! Not in a little bit.

speaker: Griffin
lines: And she rolls the truck to a stop and she turns off the engine and she says

speaker: Mama
lines: We’re here.

speaker: Griffin
lines: And where “here” is, where this truck has parked, is in front of a large building at the end of this dirt road, with a wooden sign hanging over the entrance that reads Amnesty Lodge. [music starts playing] There’s a wooden plank path cutting through a charming, well-tended garden, and up to this geodesic wooden dome that serves as the lodge’s central lobby. And branching off either side of that central hub are the lodge’s two guest wings, which have sort of a natural log-cabin aesthetic, with these lamplit verandas peeking out of each room. And Mama leads you into that lobby, where a few guests are seated in handcrafted wooden chairs, one is reading a newspaper. A couple are laughing over a game of chess. One is dusting the surface of a piano.

speaker: In the rear of this lobby is a large open space with windows looking outward into the woods with dining tables scattered about, with chairs sort of stacked upside down on top of them as dinner service isn’t really running right now. There’s a cut-out window in this dining space into a small kitchen, there’s this kind of faint smell of sulfur in the air, and you notice that there’s a small sign hanging in the entrance to one of those guest wings directing guests to a hot spring behind the building. And there’s a large hearth in the middle of this room, and it’s unlit, but just being in this building, just being in the Amnesty Lodge, you feel warm. And a young blond man dressed in snowboarder’s gear comes running out of the wings towards the entrance. Mama intercepts him and says
Mama
lines: Well don’t go out tonight, Jake, I need you to make up a room for our new guest.

speaker: Travis
lines: Jake Coolice? [pronounced “cool ice”] Or whatever his name is?

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah, it is Jake Coolice.

speaker: Clint
lines: Jaaake!

speaker: Griffin
lines: And he flashes a hang-ten, and he says

speaker: Jake Coolice
lines: No problem, Mama.

speaker: Griffin
lines: And he retreats back into that guest wing.

speaker: Aubrey
lines: Oh, I hate him. Who was that?

speaker: Mama
lines: You hate— nobody hates Jake Coolice.

speaker: Aubrey
lines: I hate him.

speaker: Griffin
lines: [crosstalk] When you say that, everybody, all the guests like look to you with a start. “Did she just say she hates Jake Coolice?”

speaker: Aubrey
lines: I was just kidding, it’s… woah, [brightly] hey! This is Dr. Harris Bonkers.

speaker: Clint
lines: [laughs] Who can defuse any situation.

speaker: Travis
lines: Yeah, Dr. Harris Bonkers is kind of Aubrey’s, like, go-to, “Did you see this rabbit?”

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah. Mama says

speaker: Mama
lines: So, uh...are you hungry? I can see if Barclay’s around to whip you up some food.

speaker: Aubrey
lines: Um, you know, let’s talk about my hierarchy of needs. Right now, I just kinda wanna know what’s going on. Um, then burger.

speaker: Griffin
lines: She says

speaker: Mama
lines: Yeah, that’s probably a good order of operations there. Alright, well, first things first, hey—

speaker: Aubrey
lines: Oh actually, I need a bathroom first. You know, long car trip. First thing I do when I get to a hotel…

speaker: Griffin
lines: She says

speaker: Mama
lines: Yeah, alright, you can use the one in the lobby.

speaker: Griffin
lines: She gestures over to a bathroom door with a toilet sign hanging on it. She says

speaker: Mama
lines: Go for it, but then I promise I’m gonna explain everything that’s goin’ on.

speaker: Travis
lines: Aubrey goes to the bathroom and comes back. Just, no one ever goes to the bathroom and stuff, and so, I just—

speaker: Griffin
lines: [amused] I thought you were setting up some sort of—

speaker: Travis
lines: No. I just—

speaker: Griffin
lines: Aubrey makes a bomb out of the bathroom supplies, just in case.

speaker: Travis
lines: No, Aubrey comes to the bathroom and comes back.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Alright.

speaker: Travis
lines: It’s an actual human function.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Mama says

speaker: Mama
lines: How’d it go in there?

speaker: Aubrey
lines: It was great. Thank you for asking. Now... what the fuck?

speaker: Griffin
lines: She says

speaker: Mama
lines: Alright, now first things first, hey Dani, I need you to see somethin’.

speaker: Griffin
lines: And the guest reading the newspaper puts it down and you see sort of a young, earthy looking woman, kinda crunchy-looking woman with long blonde hair, and she’s looking up from the newspaper and she’s staring at you, Aubrey. And Mama walks over to the hearth in the center of the room and she pulls away this grate surrounding it. She says

speaker: Mama
lines: Alright, Aubrey. Show us what you can do. And I mean the real stuff, not the flash paper stuff.

speaker: Travis
lines: This is very important, and I know you’re gonna try to dismiss it at first. Is Dani cute?

speaker: Griffin
lines: Uh, yeah? Yeah, I think, I mean does Aubrey find her cute? I feel like that would be, I don’t know what—

speaker: Travis
lines: Yes, she does, that’s why I asked. ‘Cause I want to know if Aubrey’s nervous or not performing in front of Dani.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay, then yes, absolutely.

speaker: Travis
lines: Okay, because I kind of think like, in a very traditional...so basing this off of… I’m very inspired by Harry Dresden for this, a lot of, like, the Dresden kind of magic, and magic in general is like inspired by emotion and channelling will and emotion, that kinda thing. And so one of the reasons I think it sparks for Aubrey while she’s performing is, you know, that rush of endorphins of like, in front of a crowd and the nervousness—

speaker: Griffin
lines: [crosstalk] I think that’s really rad. I also think if we make that canon that your emotional state sort of affects your magic, you can use that in some cool ways, and I’m also gonna use that in some cool, maybe bad for you, ways. Okay.

speaker: Travis
lines: [crosstalk] Oh, absolutely. That’s why I picked Fire and Blast and all of that, cuz I think Aubrey is very emotional, very reactive, and I want that to be part of it, you know what I mean? ‘Cuz I also think, as you said, it can be both beneficial and detrimental.

speaker: Griffin
lines: The term “very emotional” feels kind of weighted. I—

speaker: Travis
lines: Not “very emotional,” that’s not what I mean. She is heart-on-her-sleeve, open, you know what I mean?

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah.

speaker: Travis
lines: Whereas, I think, like Nadiya that I played is like very introspective.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah, sure I got ya.

speaker: Travis
lines: That ain’t Aubrey.

speaker: Griffin
lines: So if you’re using just your basic fire magic I think this would just be your move, right? Your Spell-Slinger thing.

speaker: Travis
lines: Yeah.

speaker: Griffin
lines: We should make it clear, just for the future, that The Spell-Slinger has, essentially, instead of like a main attack, they have a magical attack, but that is different from Use Magic, which is a sort of contextual… there’s a bunch of different effects. But if you’re trying to set something on fire, I feel like it would be The Spell-Slinger’s fire attack, which is what you’ve got.

speaker: Travis
lines: Mmhm. Am I doing my plus Weird roll, then?

speaker: Griffin
lines: It’s definitely gonna be a plus Weird roll. I guess the question is, is this an attack on the fireplace, or is this a magical effect?

speaker: Travis
lines: Well, okay, I think, first time out, Aubrey would cheat and use her, like, magician shit.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Alright, well then you don’t roll plus Weird. You just do it.

speaker: Travis
lines: Uh, it’s a six. Oh, okay.

speaker: Griffin
lines: No, I’m saying you don’t have to… if you’re not using your actual magic, if you are using flash p- and this is also something we should set in stone, if you’re just using your, if you’re doing a trick, I don’t think it’s a magic roll.

speaker: Travis
lines: Oh, okay.

speaker: Griffin
lines: I think it’s just you do it.

speaker: Travis
lines: Okay.

speaker: Griffin
lines: So you produce a bit of flash paper with your spark gloves, which is, like, the way that you are accustomed to doing this. And just a little flash of a flame appears and hits the logs in the center of the hearth and it doesn’t really ignite. And Mama kinda sighs and she says

speaker: Mama
lines: No... Aubrey?

speaker: Aubrey
lines: Yes?

speaker: Mama
lines: Not- not the David Copperfield shit. I’m talkin’ about the—

speaker: Aubrey
lines: Ew, gross!

speaker: Mama
lines: Okay, not the—

speaker: Aubrey
lines: You go to Copperfield?!

speaker: Mama
lines: No, it’s just that it was the first thing that popped in mind, I’m talkin’… Aubrey? The real stuff.

speaker: Aubrey
lines: Okay, um… real... magic? Okay.

speaker: Travis
lines: So I guess Aubrey, like, stares at the fire and, like, starts, you know, doing the deep breathing stuff..

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah.

speaker: Travis
lines: Um… [rolls] oh, okay, that’s fairly good. That’s a nine plus two. Eleven.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay, then I think, I love this picture of Aubrey, just like with her hands extended, this is not, she’s not doing sleight of hand right now, so she doesn’t know how to cast actual magic spells, so she doesn’t really know how to produce it. It’s like that scene in Spiderman, where he’s like “Go web, go!” It’s like that, where you don’t really exactly know what to do.

speaker: Travis
lines: [crosstalk] But I will say, following her moves, just from habit she’s still moving her hands the same way she would conjure fake—

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay. What I think—

speaker: Travis
lines: Because she has to use gestures, foci, consumables, to use spells.

speaker: Griffin
lines: What I think the great resolution to this is you catch Dani out of the corner of your eye, and you get a little nervous for a second, and then a big blast of fire appears in your hands.

speaker: Griffin
lines: And with that, I think the fire is perfectly contained, almost like it’s a blast of fire that sort of occupies just the space of this hearth. And suddenly the hearth is ablaze, and Dani kinda sits up in her chair when she sees this, and Mama says

speaker: Mama
lines: So, so Dani what do you think, is this gonna--

speaker: Aubrey
lines: Holy shit!

speaker: Mama
lines: Yeah.

speaker: Griffin
lines: She says

speaker: Mama
lines: Dani, is this what I think it is?

speaker: Aubrey
lines: Did you do that?

speaker: Mama
lines: No, Aubrey, you did that.

speaker: Aubrey
lines: Holy shit!

speaker: Griffin
lines: So she says

speaker: Mama
lines: Dani, what do you think? Is this what I think it is?

speaker: Griffin
lines: And Dani says

speaker: Aubrey
lines: Did you see that?!

speaker: Mama
lines: Yeah.

speaker: Aubrey
lines: Holy shit!

speaker: Griffin
lines: Dani says

speaker: Dani
lines: Yeah it, uh, it sure seems that way.

speaker: Griffin
lines: And Mama nods, and she swiftly walks to the front door of the Amnesty Lodge and she bolts it. And she turns back toward you. And now everybody in the lobby has sort of stopped doing what they’re doing and they’re looking at you, and Mama says

speaker: Mama
lines: Alright, Aubrey Little, what do you wanna know?

speaker: Griffin
lines: Ned. It is nearing dusk, and you’re out in the Monongahela National Forest, and you brought your big boat of a car. What is it, a Lincoln Continental Mark III? Is that what it is?

speaker: Clint
lines: It is a Lincoln Continental Mark III, 1958 biggest trunk space of any American-made car.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah, you bring that big car to a halt in these woods and you kinda survey the scene, there’s nobody around, you’ve probably driven off the trail a little bit, to get somewhere where you will not be really interrupted while you do your work. And speaking of that big trunk, what’s in it? Cuz I wanna know, what are you doing to stage this Bigfoot thing?

speaker: Travis
lines: What kinda junk do you have in your trunk?

speaker: Griffin
lines: Well I wanna know specifically, like, what are you doing to create this Bigfoot exhibit? Cuz I don’t wanna paint you into a corner if you wanna, like, cast some big footprints, or you wanna take a fake picture. I love the Wookiee costume idea and we did set that up in episode one, but I know you’ve had a little bit more time to think about it what are you doin’ to get this Bigfoot exhibit?

speaker: Clint
lines: Um, well obviously I’m going to try to fake a little bit of footage, I’ve got these very very heavy boots and it’s an old, they were originally just great big snowshoes.

speaker: Justin
lines: Yeah.

speaker: Clint
lines: But he has attached to them this kinda mold, so it’ll look like a great big paw print, but it’s gonna be huge.

speaker: Griffin
lines: So you’re wearing magic shoes.

speaker: Justin
lines: Sorry, and the Wookiee costume?

speaker: Clint
lines: I’ve got those on, I’ve got the Wookiee costume on, I’m sorry purists, but I did not bring the bandolier, I thought that might throw some people off.

speaker: Justin
lines: I love this.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Alright, yeah, that’s too much.

speaker: Clint
lines: I strap these great big boots, like snowshoes with the handles cut off, and these big latex things to look like giant footprints, but I mean they’re like y’know… [pauses] 20 inches, so I’m not gonna be able to move real fast. And I’ve got a camera.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah, I think it’s probably Kirby’s camera that he uses for the paper that he loaned out to you.

speaker: Clint
lines: Right, and I’ve got it on a tripod, and I’ve also brought along, I had, don’t ask me how, but I had this big vat that I went and got right directly out of the cesspool in the backyard, and it’s just filled with this nasty sewage schmeggy stuff and it’s—

speaker: Travis
lines: Why?

speaker: Clint
lines: Well, just bear with me, and I’ve got it in this great big, like gallon—

speaker: Travis
lines: He’s making Bigfoot dookie.

speaker: Clint
lines: Jug. I’m making Bigfoot scent. The spoor, the spoor is gonna be on the wind tonight.

speaker: Travis
lines: Jesus Christ.

speaker: Justin
lines: [crosstalk] This should be pretty good.

speaker: Clint
lines: So let’s see the marketers create something outta that.

speaker: Justin
lines: Yeah.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Anything else in the trunk?

speaker: Clint
lines: Well, my walking stick, but I don’t think that’d be a very good idea for me to carry my walking stick.

speaker: Griffin
lines: [crosstalk] Alright, sure. Well, let’s say you’re setting up the camera and you get it sort of angled toward a thick patch of these pine trees.

speaker: Clint
lines: Right.

speaker: Griffin
lines: That are just, they’re just everywhere, they’re just sort of the defining arboreal characteristic of Kepler are these tall pines. And you get a good sorta angle where you could be hidden, a little bit, ‘cause you still want that air of mystery. If the footage is, like, Bigfoot right up against you then it’s pretty easy to be like, “Oh, well that’s bullshit.” So you set up that camera and, I don’t even think we have to roll for it I do just wanna play it out, though. So what do you do?

speaker: Clint
lines: So I set up the camera, and I can’t make the buttons work while I got the gloves on, so I take the gloves off. It’s really hard ‘cuz it’s a really complicated camera, so there’s a lot of [yells] “Damn it!” So finally I get the camera, I’ve got it on a video setting.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Alright.

speaker: Clint
lines: And I pull the gloves back on, and I walk, and I set it at a stationary point. I’ve already, you know, sprinkled probably half of the cesspool, the Bigfoot spoor, musk, whatever I’m gonna pretend it is, in various locations around there. And so I step out of frame, and I’m getting myself psyched up. I’m thinking back on my dramatic training, you know, and I’m kinda singing to myself, to get my, y’know—

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah. Sure.

speaker: Clint
lines: [sings Into the Woods] The way is clear, the light is good. I’m getting all pumped up, and then I roll my shoulders up and I kinda hunch up, and I start to lumber, you know, I lumber into the shot, and I walk around and I’m making an effort to keep my face kind of away from the—

speaker: Griffin
lines: Are you wearing a mask?

speaker: Clint
lines: Oh I got my Wookiee head, my Wookiee head’s on.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay.

speaker: Clint
lines: I got the Wookiee head on. I used a little bit of makeup to, like, put weird markings on it. I’ve streaked the wookie fur. I mean, you know, it’s not gonna be so obvious to be like, Peter Mayhew.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Sure.

speaker: Clint
lines: And I’m lumbering, and I’m making a [growls].

speaker: Griffin
lines: Do you get the… I feel like we got the scene. Do you get it in one take? Or, whats… do you get it in one? Are you one-take Ned?

speaker: Clint
lines: Well, I take a one, but then I didn’t like my motivation, and I really didn’t like the voice, so I’m setting up and I blur it up a little bit. It was a little bit too in-focus, you know.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah.

speaker: Clint
lines: So I take a little bit out of focus, and I’m lumbering, and here I got again, and I’m set, ready, and go. And I lumber a little bit more threatening, now I look a little bit more, you know, bestial.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Got it.

speaker: Clint
lines: And I’m making a different noise, I’m trying out [makes more high-pitched animal noise]

speaker: Griffin
lines: Let’s say that’s the magic take, you get the—

speaker: Clint
lines: [crosstalk] That’s good, that’s a ten.

speaker: Griffin
lines: The light is, it’s the golden hour, the light is perfect.

speaker: Clint
lines: I step out of the frame and I say

speaker: Ned
lines: And scene.

speaker: Griffin
lines: And that’s where we are, I think you pop your mask off, and you’re looking at the footage on the LCD display on the back of the camera, and you’re looking at the footage, and you’re feeling pretty good about it. It looks like you did a great job of sort of making it visible, but not like, too clear. And you got your mask off and you’re looking at this footage, and it is while you are looking at this footage that you see a figure emerge from the woods. You see a guy pop out from behind… not pop out to like surprise you, he’s just walking, but you see him.

speaker: Clint
lines: Do I notice him, could I notice him in the playback first?

speaker: Griffin
lines: No, I don’t think he was that close to you.

speaker: Clint
lines: Oh, okay.

speaker: Griffin
lines: I think you got good, clean, fake Bigfoot footage. But you see this man walk out of the woods, and he’s tall and kinda burly, he’s wearing a flannel shirt. He’s got a scruffy beard, he’s walking kinda slowly, with intent, and he’s got his arms stuck out. And you can see, dangling from his closed fist, there’s this chain with a faintly glowing orange crystal at the end of it. And he’s paying rapt attention to this pendant that he’s holding until he spots you. And he clumsily tries to, sorta, nonchalantly pull it back up into his hand to hide it, and this man says

speaker: Man
lines: Oh, hey. Hi. Hello, other— other person. You’re… here. And that’s great. Hi.

speaker: Ned
lines: Hail, friend. W-w-what are you doing?

speaker: Man
lines: What are you— What’s, why are you dressed up like Chewbacca, it looks like, maybe, a little bit.

speaker: Ned
lines: Um, I’m getting in on this fan-film thing, you know how fans make, uh… films, to try and get noticed by film studios.

speaker: Man
lines: Cool, I love Star Wars, yeah.

speaker: Ned
lines: Yeah, and so I thought, “Hey, make a Chewbacca, you know, fan film, and maybe—” [laughs]

speaker: Man
lines: So you’re by yourself in the woods out here in the middle of the night?

speaker: Ned
lines: Yes, well, you know, keep it streamlined, you know, keep it small. Cut out the middleman, make yourself a ton of money. At the very least they may pay you a bunch of money, you know, to not put out the product, so.

speaker: Man
lines: Cool.

speaker: Ned
lines: Just a little Youtube, fol-de-rol. [Laughs]

speaker: Griffin
lines: This man looks kind of nervous. Just as you kind of didn’t anticipate seeing anybody out in the woods tonight, you get the sense that he also did not anticipate seeing anybody else out in the woods tonight. And he says

speaker: Man
lines: So you, uh planning on sticking around for much longer?

speaker: Ned
lines: [laughs] No, no, no, deadlines and commitments, you know? I’ve gotta get back on my computer and look at variety.com and of course we’ve got editing and post-production and everything else so no, I’m just gonna put this equipment right here in my big old trunk and get the hell outta here.

speaker: Griffin
lines: He says

speaker: Barclay
lines: Well, alright, it was nice to meet ya, my name’s Barclay, by the way. What’s yours?

speaker: Ned
lines: Barclay, hey, Barclay. Oh! The cook from the lodge, correct?

speaker: Griffin
lines: He flashes a smile and he’s like

speaker: Barclay
lines: I don’t remember seeing you at the lodge, I dunno. Yeah I mean, that’s my job. What’s your name?

speaker: Ned
lines: You fixed me a Monte Cristo there once. Absolutely delicious. And Ned. Ned Chicane.

speaker: Barclay
lines: Oh, Ned. Yes, yes.

speaker: Ned
lines: I own the Cryptonomica.

speaker: Barclay
lines: Oh yeah, that’s why I recognize you. Alright, well it’s nice to, I guess, formally meet you. Now you’re gonna... you were just leaving, you were saying?

speaker: Griffin
lines: And as he says that, from out in the woods, almost actually directly behind where you were filming your footage, you see a figure kind of skulking toward you. And as it does, you actually see that crystal that Barclay’s trying to hide in his fist, you see it kind of shining through the cracks in his fingers. And there’s something wrong with this figure that’s skulking out of the woods. It’s moving kind of unnaturally, it’s neck is, like, cocked to the side. It has this trail of black ooze kind of streaming out of its mouth, and though it’s moving, its face looks kind of lifeless. But all that aside, you recognize this figure because you’ve lived in the mountains of West Virginia long enough. It’s a bobcat.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Duck, you have walked these woods more days than nearly every other living human being. You’ve been doing this long enough that you’ve traversed all over, but for reasons beyond your understanding, you’ve never stood at this spot and seen this stone archway. It’s a humble thing, it’s just two slabs of solid stone with a third perched on top between them— kind of like the gates of Stonehenge— and the moonlight is shining down on it as the moon reaches its zenith overhead, nearly full. And the air is still again, save for the sounds of that enormous being that just attacked you, in the distance, that’s still sort of rooting through the woods. But it’s pretty far off, that noise. And as you’re looking at this stone gateway shining in the moonlight, that vision appears to you once again, and she’s several feet away from you, and she’s investigating this archway kind of curiously. And she says

speaker: Presence
lines: So this is your connection? Fascinating!

speaker: Duck
lines: Sorry, I don’t— I don’t, uh, understand.

speaker: Griffin
lines: I think, when you say that, you hear that monster, and now it’s just a little bit louder. Just a little bit closer to you, and this vision in front of you says

speaker: Presence
lines: You are not ready to face your destiny, Duck Newton, and yet you must. The people in the world beyond this gate will be your friends, regardless of what the people of your world try to tell you!

speaker: Duck
lines: Um. See, right now I’m in a bit of a pickle. I got a, appears to be some sort of monster, believe it or not, kind of bearin’ down—

speaker: Clint
lines: [amused] Bearin’ down!

speaker: Duck
lines: —if you will. So I should just head on th…? Will the monster follow me through the gate? It just looks—

speaker: Griffin
lines: Uh, no. It wouldn’t. And you just know that, just because it’s not big enough.

speaker: Justin
lines: All right. Well, that seems a good a [sic] option as any.

speaker: Duck
lines: Um, do you have a permit for this, by the way, or—?

speaker: Griffin
lines: I think she just disregards your question. She takes a moment, almost like, uh, like she’s trying to process what you’ve just asked, but doesn’t even understand how to begin answering that, and she says

speaker: Presence
lines: Enter the gateway, Duck Newton! You will be brave, Duck Newton! That is why you—

speaker: Griffin
lines: And then she’s gone again, and it’s just you, and the gate, and the monster in the woods behind you.

speaker: Justin
lines: All right. I mean, I guess I run through the gate.

speaker: Griffin
lines: You hear the sound of the monster getting louder and louder, and you run towards this empty gate. As you do, the moon overhead reaches its absolute zenith, and where you could once see sort of the forest beyond the archway, now you just see this solid plane of dazzling white light. And it rattles you for just a moment, as do the sharp winds that are blowing away from the gate in every direction. But you continue your approach, with your hand nervously outstretched, and your fingers graze the light.

speaker: And then we see the woods from above, and we see this circle of light retreat inward almost as quickly as it appeared, until it is no more. And then we see that clearing again, and the air is still, and the evening is quiet, and the archway is empty.
Griffin
lines: Aubrey what kind of questions do you have for Mama?

speaker: Aubrey
lines: [stuttering, a lot] Um. So. I-I-I can magic? Magic is real?

speaker: Griffin
lines: She says

speaker: Mama
lines: Yeah, Aubrey, what you did up there tonight was real, actual magic. So I guess that’s the first big thing magic is real. Because there’s a place that magic comes from. There’s— I’m gonna try to take this slow so that your mind doesn’t literally dissolve, but—there’s another world, one that is connected to our own. And that connection, it’s popped up in so many places around the world throughout time, and right now it’s here in Kepler. And this other world, Aubrey, it’s an incredible place and a dangerous place, and us humans have been crossin’ over into it for, well, as long as we’ve been around, I guess, and we’ve been bringin’ back stories and folktales, which, surprise! They’re mostly true. But—but that connection, Aubrey, it ain’t a one-way thing. They’ve been crossin’ over too.

speaker: Griffin
lines: And Mama looks at the guests in this lobby and she nods. And they look kinda nervous for a second, but then one by one they stand up, and they start undoing different accessories some bracelets, necklaces, a couple of them slip off rings that they’re wearing, and one by one they transform. The two guests seated at the chessboard grow in stature, and grow these thick layers of fur surrounding them, and suddenly they’re just werewolves. The guest that was dusting the piano turns transparent and spectral. And Dani’s skin starts glowing slightly, and her eyes turn this dark orange, and her teeth become long and pointed, and you are suddenly standing in this lobby with a bunch of monsters.

speaker: Aubrey
lines: Oh, okay.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Mama says

speaker: Mama
lines: You okay? You all right? I know this is a lot.

speaker: Aubrey
lines: Yeah, no, I’ve watched movies and TV shows before, so this actually isn’t as surprising as you might think.

speaker: Griffin
lines: She kinda laughs and says

speaker: Mama
lines: Most people don’t take this as well, so I’m glad that you are, listen—

speaker: Aubrey
lines: Well, it’s one of those things where I’ve always, you know, no matter how skeptical you are about, like, sci-fi and fantasy stuff. There’s also always a part of your mind that’s like “but maaaybe,” and so, this is one of those things where it’s like yeah, okay. Yeah, sure. Sure sure sure.

speaker: Griffin
lines: She says

speaker: Mama
lines: So, that’s the truth of the matter. Monsters are real. But as is the case with so many of life’s profound curiosities, well, there’s a lot more to it than just that.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Barclay kinda has his arm at his side. And his hand, the one that wasn’t holding the crystal, his fingers are kind of stretched out, almost like he’s sorta giving you a “Stay back,” and he says out of the side of his mouth, he says

speaker: Barclay
lines: Walk slowly to the car, and go.

speaker: Ned
lines: Um, I ordinarily would—

speaker: Barclay
lines: Ssshhh.

speaker: Ned
lines: [quietly] All right. But you need to come with me, and get in the car. The trunk is already open, all right? Just jump in the trunk and I’ll get behind the steering wheel, and we’ll get out of here.

speaker: Griffin
lines: He says

speaker: Barclay
lines: [also speaking softly] Okay, I’m going to start walking backwards slowly, and you do that also.

speaker: Griffin
lines: And the two of you start walking backwards slowly, and Barclay steps on a twig that snaps. And as that happens, the bobcat starts charging toward you. And it’s coming at you fast, and Barclay looks at you, and he says

speaker: Barclay
lines: God, I hope you can keep a secret.

speaker: Griffin
lines: And he starts running towards the bobcat, and he pulls up his shirtsleeve, and you see him untie a hempen bracelet. And in the blink of an eye, this gentle, bearded man you were just talking to disappears, and in his place is Bigfoot.

speaker: [Theme music (The Adventure Zone
lines: Amnesty Theme by Griffin McElroy) plays]
